WorkItem.ClosedComment: That is the entire point of the example. See http://www.typescriptlang.org/Tutorial
WorkItem.Description:
http://www.typescriptlang.org/Playground

1) load "Walkthrough: Javascript"
2) click run, click button

ACTUAL: alert: "Hello, [object Object]"
EXPECTED: alert: "Hello, world"

Line 9 is `var greeter = new Greeter({message: "world"});`
It should be `var greeter = new Greeter("world");`

Comments.Message: Well, I think if people are going to the playground to try the samples from the *main page menu*, they should be shown comments in code stating the fact it `/*doesn't work on purpose*/` - it looks bad otherwise.  I had no idea myself those examples are for examples/tutorials (or at least that one).
